Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Identified that tickets with escalations to Level-2 agents (Tickets 102, 104, and 105) tend to have significantly longer resolution times compared to tickets resolved at Level-1.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Concluded that the escalation to Level-2 agents is a key factor contributing to delays, based on the consistent observation of longer durations in cases with escalations.

Name: Inductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Assumed that delays caused by escalations might be related to workload or efficiency of Level-2 agents, inferred from long gaps between escalation and investigation start times.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Validated the hypothesis by analyzing specific time gaps, such as the 5-hour delay between escalation and investigation in Ticket 105.

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Proposed training or resource allocation for Level-2 agents and prioritized escalated tickets to mitigate delays.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Explored the possibility that the investigation process itself might be inefficient, requiring closer monitoring of Level-2 operations.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - IND
Text: Suggested that resource allocation or task prioritization issues might explain delays post-escalation, though further data would be needed to confirm this.

Name: Counterfactual Reasoning - IND
Text: Considered if removing escalations altogether would reduce ticket resolution times, but recognized that some issues inherently require Level-2 expertise.
